Comment: 2. Forget what this gambit is called....its pretty strong, have had fair success against a lot of players in the 1700-2000 range with it....W gets a fairly lasting initiative...if B takes on e4, then W plays f3, almost K's Gambit like without the aggravation of black playing g5, and threatening counterplay on the d8...h4 diagonal...declining is fine, too

16.  Yes, sirree....the Caro-K and French are funny....its almost dangerous in them to win material early, you get thrown on the defensive and may never escape....better to hunker down....slowly equalize, and try to win material down the road...the game is over now.
